paper_metadata.title: This paper evaluates the impact of China's poverty alleviation policy (CPAP) on the evolution of the industrial structure in poverty-stricken counties

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Many countries have attempted to alleviate poverty directly by providing social welfare to impoverished households, such as offering cash and in-kind assistance

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Using a panel dataset of 2099 counties from 2010 to 2020, we construct an industrial classification framework and measure diversification through the equilibrium index
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: employing a difference-in-differences (DID) model to examine the impact of CPAP on the industrial structure of newly established enterprises in poverty-stricken counties

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This paper evaluates the impact of China's poverty alleviation policy (CPAP) on the evolution of the industrial structure in poverty-stricken counties
evidence_citations.country_citation: Since the founding of the People's Republic of China, poverty alleviation has been one of the government's top priorities
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: By 2020, tens of millions of impoverished rural populations, according to current standards, had been lifted out of poverty, and all poverty-stricken counties had fully exited the poverty-stricken county list
